title: What is React & Why React?
description: Understand React from zero: the problem before React, its history, and why developers love it

refresher.title: üèóÔ∏è The Problem Before React
refresher.content:
# Real-Life Story: Gym Notice Board Chaos

Imagine the **React Gym** notice board:

- Trainers update schedules manually
- Members check classes
- Board often shows wrong info

Problems:
- Updating one class breaks others
- Rewriting parts is slow
- Hard to manage for multiple branches

---

## What React Does

React is like a **digital, self-updating notice board**:

- Automatically updates only what changes
- Reusable components (like mini boards)
- Easy to maintain and scale

React is a **JavaScript library for building UI**.

---

## Key Features

- **Components**: Mini building blocks
- **JSX**: HTML inside JS
- **State & Props**: Remember and communicate data
- **Virtual DOM**: Fast updates without full refresh

negative.title: üêõ Mistake: Multiple DOM Updates
negative.description: Directly updating HTML instead of React component.
negative.question: Why is this approach bad in React?

options.explanation: React can render HTML via JSX. That‚Äôs not the issue.

options.text: Direct DOM updates overwrite previous content
options.explanation: ‚úÖ Correct! Each update replaces the previous one. React manages updates intelligently using Virtual DOM.
Yes, slower is a side effect, but main problem is overwriting.

negative.lesson: React avoids overwriting UI manually. Always use **components** and **state**.
